str2: That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Clay, mud. Perhaps a primary word; clay.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To spread on, anoint. From epi and chrio; to smear over.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To go away, depart, begone, die. From hupo and ago; to lead under, i.e. Withdraw or retire, literally or figuratively.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Siloam, a spring within the walls, in the south-east corner of Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Siloam, a pool of Jerusalem.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To wash; mid. I wash my own (hands, etc.). To cleanse; ceremonially, to perform ablution.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To wash; mid. I wash my own (hands, etc.). To cleanse; ceremonially, to perform ablution.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To look up, recover my sight. From ana and blepo; to look up; by implication, to recover sight.
